alert.note: Alert for Coke (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 15 at 6:41PM CDT until further notice by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Coke, Runnels and Tom Green. * WHEN...Until 845 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 641 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Angelo, Miles, Orient, Veribest, Grape Creek and Harriet. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... FM 1692 crossing Sales Branch, FM 1692 crossing The Draw, FM 1692 crossing Concho River, Mule Creek Road crossing Mule Creek, County Road 364 crossing Red Bank Creek, Red Bank crossing Red Bank Creek, County Road 194 crossing Red Bank Creek, County Road 357 crossing Little Concho Creek, crossings along County Road 363 and crossings along County Road 387. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
